lessons.title: Meet the Chess Pieces
lessons.intro: Hello, little champions! Welcome to your first chess lesson. Chess is a fun thinking game and is about making smart moves.

questions.prompt: Let me ask me you something first: Do you know what this is?
questions.lesson: Let me introduce you to the stars of the chess world. Meet the king, he wears the tall crown and comes with a cross.

questions.prompt: Do you know what piece is this?
questions.lesson: Lets meet the Queen. She wears a princess crown.
Pawns are the little soldiers with the round tops.
The Knight looks like a little horse.
The Bishop looks like it is wearing a little hat and is tall and thin.
The Rook looks like a small castle and stand in the corners.

lessons.title: Where do the Pieces Go?
lessons.intro: Let's set up the board before we play. There are two colors in chess, white and black, One player uses white pieces and the other player uses black pieces.

questions.prompt: How many different colors of chess pieces are there?
questions.lesson: Now let's start placing the pieces. First, we place the pawns. All the pawns line up together in one row. They go on the second line of your chessboard.

questions.prompt: In what line do all the pawns line up?
questions.lesson: Let's place the rooks. Each player has two rooks. The rooks go in the corners of the board.
Now we place the knights. Each knight goes next to a rook. One knight stands next to the left rook. One knight stands next to the right rook.
Now we place the bishops. Each bishop goes next to a knight. There are two bishops, one on each side.
Now let's place the queen. The queen goes in the middle. She always goes on her own color. White queen on a white square. Black queen on a black square.
The last piece is the king. The king always stands right next to the queen.
